programme.desc: Did a filmmaker capture footage of a wooly mammoth crossing a river in Siberia? Is a recording of a long moaning howl proof that Bigfoot lives in Ohio? Is Sophia the talking robot really out to destroy humanity?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Ultimate Evidence
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a closer look at the evidence as he asks whether Earths stone monoliths were built with extra terrestrial help.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller comes into the shop with some chef whites signed by the actor who played the iconic Soup Nazi on Seinfeld. Will Rick and Chum say No deal for you! or will they reach an agreement on price?

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While new discoveries across the island continue to invigorate the team, a dangerous storm threatens to shut down the entire operation.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. But can these mysterious curses really have the power to bring us harm? And if so, is it possible to understand their power?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey dart out of the shop to check out a 1968 convertible. Will the negotiations be speedy, or will the duo dodge a bad deal? Then, make no bones about it, Chum wants a piece of an Oreodont fossil. But can he get a dino-mite price?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick battles over a pair of vintage posters, but will he win the war? Then, Rick and Chum call on the power of Grayskull as they check out a large Battle Cat toy. Will the duo be cringing from sticker shock or be able to transform the negotiations?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Astronaut Theorist Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at The Top Ten Extraordinary Creatures weve investigated — creatures that just might provide compelling evidence of extraterrestrial visitation.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are going camping and Timmy wants to build his own tent. What does he need for his camping trip?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids search for the owner of a sketchbook that contains drawings done from a high point of view. After determining the artist wasnt drawing at the top of a ladder or up in a tree, they discover the sketchbook belongs to one of Busytowns tallest residents, Jeremy Giraffe. / Huckle and gang investigate a strange temperature drop which turns Busytowns summer to winter.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Its morning time in the real world and Messy wakes up to hear a noisy song bird chirping outside his bedroom window. “Who’s making all that noise first thing in the morning?” asks a grumpy Messy. He tries to start up a conversation with the bird until he realises he doesn’t understand what the bird is saying. “What’s the point of singing a song with no words?” asks Messy and he transports himself to OKIDO to find out.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: It’s a wet and gloomy day in the real world. Messy is watching from inside whilst the rain pours onto his sandcastle he built earlier, it begins to melt. “Why does it have to rain?” sighs Messy. He transports himself to Okido to find out. The weather couldn’t be hotter in Okido. He greets Zoe and Felix in the garden who can’t wait to show Messy their beautiful sunflowers before the Mayor of Okido comes judge them in the City in Bloom competition this afternoon.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Asked by the girls to play Prince Berry Charming in the new play that Plum is directing for the Baby Berrykins, Huck pushes aside his reluctance and says yes. Bad goes to comically worse as the girls discover he can’t act, can’t dance, can’t sing, suffers from extreme stage fright, and never really wanted to do the play in the first place. After dress rehearsal devolves into a comedy of errors, Strawberry finally gets the sheepish Huck to confess that acting, singing and dancing are just not for him.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry finds a nest with an egg in it he wants to keep it, but Nana explains that it wouldnt be fair.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to stay up all night so he goes to Dino-World where he can play for as long as he wants.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was driving her dirt bike in the Philippine forest, admiring the view while doing trick before experiencing an earthquake. She then wants to investigate in hopes to save an animal that may be injured. Back in the garden, Leo is relaxing in the shade of a tree, looking up clouds. Katie then appear with her tablet and inform of an earthquake in the Philippine, and the Junior Rangers worried since Farah was on patrol there. Farah then calls up Leo and informs him of an animal she discover. After the Junior Rangers learn more about the animal with Katies computer, they agree to meet up with Farah there. Leo, Katie and Farah sees that the Philippine Eaglet is watching them from afar, and Farah warns them to not be close. The Eaglet then approaches Hero hungrily, which Hero flies in the air with its jetpack. The Junior Rangers sees that the Eaglet may not know how to fly and they decided to teach it how. Their attempt didnt work out and they later meet up with Ranger Rocky. They explain their situation, causing him to call up Ranger Joey for more information.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Gordon is late to pull the Express the Fat Controller gives it to Henry instead. Because Gordon has said how difficult his work is, Henry doubts he’s up to the job but more than proves himself and all the passengers love him. Gordon is left to take over Henry’s work, which he thinks is beneath him, and he ends up going on strike. The Fat Controller insists Gordon pulls the Flying Kipper as penance but Gordon refuses till Henry makes Gordon think the job is too hard for him, spurring Gordon to prove Henry wrong

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel always likes to appear rough and tough in front of Arry and Bert. But when Thomas, unexpectedly, finds him lovingly fussing over some baby ducklings he threatens to tell everyone that Diesel is just a big softie. Diesel is horrified and promises to be nice to everyone in exchange for Thomas not telling anyone about the ducklings. All the engines are pleasantly surprised when Diesel starts being polite and friendly, but just how long can he keep it up?

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to pilot a special drone that Mr Guellec bought for his farm, where a Rainbow Magpie is ruining his fruits. The drone’s loudspeaker is supposed to emit a sound that will repel the bird in a harmless way, but things don’t go as planned. Not only does the Rainbow Magpie look unaffected by the drone, but it even mistakes it for a bird and chases after it. Grisu has a hard time shooing the bird away - with Fumè’s intervention making things worse - until he finds out that luring it to the nearby forest is much more effective…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu helps Toramento, who is setting up a sightseeing tour of the Pink Cave of the Valley. But some funny facts happen in the Cave: signs moving apparently by themselves, strange noises… Toramento suspects that a ghost lives there, but Grisu doesn’t believe it. After a little mayhem, the little dragon finds out that the funny facts are caused by a small but sassy bat, who lives in the Cave and is annoyed by artificial light. Eventually, Grisu, helped by Stella and Toramento, creates a light system built with luminescent rocks, that spreads a soft glow that doesn’t annoy the bat.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster and Wilson compete to earn their ‘Helping Wheels’ badge. However they get so caught up trying to outdo each other, that they don’t help anyone. Koko beats them to it, winning her badge by helping a little girl rescue her kite. In the end, Wilson and Brewster help each other out and decide to work together as a team to earn their badge.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Its the first day of summer, which badgers celebrate and call Happy Poppy Day. Edmund wants to prepare Yolanda’s delicacies, a sweet specialty, which Scoutbadger, Woodsy and Berry’s mother used to bake on that day using poppy flowers. To make these delicacies, you need poppies, the recipe and thecontainers in which they should be served…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Saffi has won a “Design a Statue” competition and now Bob and the team are turning her design into a water-fountain for the shopping mall. Saffi explains that her elephant statue design was based on her favourite toy, Mr Trunkers, but has since lost him. So when Muck is chosen to deliver the elephant statue, he promises to take extra special care of it for Saffi. But in his excitement, Muck accidentally knocks the elephant into a wall and scrapes off its paint. Muck can’t quite bring himself to own up to Saffi, so decides to tell Bob what has happened first. On his way to tell Bob, Muck overhears Anish telling Saffi how proud he is of her statue. Muck panics and ends up damaging the elephant more.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Skye Sampson asks Bob and Team to create a beach motocross course on Fixham Beach, Bob is so enthused he decides to compete himself. But it’s been a while since he’s ridden his old bike and he wonders if it will even make it round the course. While Bob and Curtis work on the bike, word gets out that there is a mysterious entrant called the Masked Biker. Scoop and Muck become convinced that the Masked Biker is Leo, hiding his identity to take part even though he isn’t old enough to race.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Someone in Busytown Park got rid of Sally and Hildas newly drawn hopscotch board. Huckle and Lowly set about helping the girls find out whos responsible. As it turns out the culprit isnt a who, but a what - the parks new sprinkler system washed the chalk drawing clean off the sidewalk./ Mr. Gronkle’s great great grandfather has hidden a priceless treasure somewhere and it’s up to Huckle and the gang to find it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger

Their attempt didnt work out and they later meet up with Ranger Rocky. They explain their situation, causing him to call up Ranger Joey for more information.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On an Australian beach, Kyle builds a sandcastle until he stumbles upon a fishing net endangering a stranded Manta Ray. Simultaneously, Leo, Katie, and Hero engage in a garden frog hunt. Hero detects a croaking sound, leading them to a frog stuck in a drain pipe. As they rescue the frog, Kyle calls Leo about the trapped Manta Ray. From the computer, they learn about Manta Rays and their need for constant motion to breathe. Racing to the beach in PlatypusOne, they find Kyle tirelessly trying to keep the Manta Ray wet. Katies knowledge about Manta Rays prompts them to prioritize putting the fish back into the water before untangling the net. Utilizing the winch, they successfully pull the Manta Ray into the sea. However, their underwater celebration is disrupted when a fake shark fin alarmingly approaches them which turns out to be Ranger Rocky. He calls Ranger Joey who educates them on Manta Rays unique features, and they try to gently remove the net, freeing the Manta Ray. In the Garden, Hero playfully chases the frog, which ends up in the drainpipe revealing Hero to be the reason the frogs are in the pipe!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is scuba diving underwater when a big shadow looming over him. Turns out its an ocean Sunfish, floating on its side. Kai then got scared when the fish moves its eyeball, Kai calms down and continue to be interest in the fish. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are chilling in the shadow of a large tree. Hero appears and wanted to play with them as he fetch his squeaky toy. The Junior Rangers are lazy to play as they continue to laze around, upsetting Hero. Leo then receives a call from Kai about the new fish he discover. After learning more on the creature on Katies computer and learned that a pack of seagulls are harassing the fish, the Junior Rangers agrees to meetup with Kai to help. As they arrived, the seagulls are persisting in harassing while Kyle attempts to get them away. Leo and Katie tries to help, alongside Hero with his jetpack but it didnt work. The Junior Rangers are puzzled on why the fish dont move and thats when Ranger Rocky appear. They inform him of the situation, causing him to call up his good friend Ranger Joey. After Ranger Joey debriefing them with helpful information, they then sees the seagulls were actually picking parasites from the fish body. The fish then moves underwater causing the Junior Rangers to follow it. It stays underwater and decides not to move again. Hero gets distracted and has a short moment with a fish he encounters. After awhile, the sunfish spots a plastic bag in the ocean and decides to swim to it.

programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole Max thinks his son Karl is too young to go camping with the other kids. Tilda changes Max’s mind and Karl happily joins the trip. He feels insecure until he helps Tilda in an emergency.

programme.desc: Ida asks Molly, if she can look after her duckling Alina. But today of all days, Alina wants to learn how to fly and gets herself in some risky situations – and so Molly has to take some risks too.

programme.desc: Mole mother Gertrud has a cold, so Tilda watches her kids. The children teach Tilda how to dig. Unfortunately, Tilda’s tunnel leads directly to Rupert, who’s upset about the molehills in his garden.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are throwing snowballs at each other, but Simon keeps dodging Gaspards snowballs and Gaspard keeps getting hit by Simons, so Mummy comes to Gaspards rescue!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie and Hero get to know a feathery new friend—an Indian peacock! They bring the peacock to the rainforest to look for peahens, but end up crossing paths with two jungle cats.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn her badge, Koko has to deliver two different types of cargo safely. She goes too fast and nearly breaks her cargo of eggs – then goes too slow, and is nearly late with her cargo of wool. Happily, she realises that different cargos need different delivery methods: slow and steady with the eggs, but faster with the wool. Learning the difference means that she wins her badge!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees have to play a game. They have to find ‘pairs’ of chuggers behind different-coloured roundhouse doors. Koko and Brewster do well, but easily-distracted Wilson fails the first time around. After a pep talk from Vee, he applies himself – and by concentrating really hard, he wins his badge!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina finds T’choupi’s baby sister Fanni so cute that she suggests they go out and find other babies, in the hamlet. Launching a baby quest, she and T’choupi come across a chick, a baby rabbit, a caterpillar and a little snail! Next, they head to the woods to find more babies. But T’choupi suddenly gapes as he spots the cutest young animal of them all: a baby hedgehog, also known as a hoglet.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Luce has brought one of T’choupi’s favorite games: a Seek And Find game based on Nature! Mom comes along and suggests they go for a walk in the forest. The kids love the idea… as long as we can bring the game with! Mom agrees. But on the way, Luce drops the game, losing some of the pieces. She doesn’t say anything to the others, but when the time comes to start playing, the missing pieces make it impossible to continue past a certain point! Oh nooo!! So Mom suggests they play Seek And Find for real, in the forest! The first one to find a chestnut, a hedgehog or a frog…!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School

Medhi reassures his little world that it must be rabbits trotting around. But the noises get louder and everyone is amazed to see a big red tail...!

programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Nuair a tha Bing a’ cluich geama le fòn-làimhe Flop, chaneil rudan a’ dol mar bu chòir oir tha am fòn-làimhe a briseadh nuair a tha e dol na sgeing air an làr. An àite seo innse do Flop, tha Bing ga chuir dhan bhiona. Tha e faireachdainn cho dona mun seo ach tha e ag ionnsachadh gum feum e innse mar a thachair. When Bing is playing a game with Flop’s mobile phone, he accidentally drops the mobile and it breaks. Instead of telling Flop, he throws it in the bin. He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!

However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: The chef Monkey wants to make his famous banana honey sandwich. He discovers that there is no honey, parrot eat it all. Mole appears and tells them of the bees honey making abilities. They journey off to the meadow where they meet a sweet honeybee who not only supplies them with honey, but also joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: It’s the Pontypandy Ocean Parade and Hannah is determined to beat the other vessels to the finish with her Submaster 2000, but because she decides to bypass several of Joes safety features, the most unlikely vessel wins.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: James has the idea of using the horse and cart to deliver his team’s forgotten cherry pop to a tasting competition. / Norman practices his magic act for the talent show, but it turns out that his assistant Mandy is better at magic than he is.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate assumes that it was Dad who played a funny April Fool’s Day joke on her. In Mimiloo, a trickster plays funny gags on Kate and her friends, leading the gang into the spirit of silly tricks themselves. It takes everyone to figure out who the original jokester is—things aren’t always what they seem!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate is building a sand castle, but the windchimes she places on top aren’t working. In Mimiloo, after Mim-Mim accidentally ruins a one-of-a-kind music recording, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends visit the Singing Seas where Callie, a giant octopus, keeps her Mega Music Maker. But it’s broken! Kate leads the gang on a quest to fix the island-sized instrument.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is proud to have been put in charge of feeding Nina’s animals while she’s away. But when he accidentally drops some eggs and commits a series of blunders, the animals change their behavior, and even seem to start avoiding him! Are they upset with T’choupi for being so clumsy?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi discovers Nina’s beautiful dried flowers. He’s so impressed that he wants to make his own collection, as a birthday present for his mom! So, he Nina and Benedicte secretly head off to pick some pretty flowers. But they’re going to have to turn it around fast: they only have one day to get the job done!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The rain thwarts Sam and Julias play plans for the day. Since a rain is always followed by a rainbow, why not making one in order to push the rain stop falling? But how to make a rainbow?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Suspecting that each others life would be suits them better, Sam and Julia swap places for a few hours. But is Sams life really funnier than Julias? And her life calmer than Sams?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert finds out that Molly has a beautiful singing voice and asks her if she can sing a song for Tildas birthday. Molly absolutely wants to do this but can she overcome her stage fright?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets each receive surprise packages with little instruments, but Poet and Turbulent are quite jealous of Girl’s pretty trumpet. No wonder we werent lucky, its Friday the 13th. But the little girl explains that luck is all about what state of mind you are in. She tells them the story of Allpink and Allgrey, a little boy who believed Friday the 13th was a lucky day and another one who thought it only brought bad luck.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When Grandpa discovers tons of holes in his garden he immediately suspects Toto, who happens to be covered in mud. But the Triplets find many excuses to protect their little dog. They really have to find a solution to help him lose this bad habit and are convinced that he needs to keep busy. It would be easier if Toto were not so lazy! However, when Grandpas back akes too much to dig holes and plant seeds, Toto saves the day.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger and Rosie are determined to find out who are the best, between badgers and foxes! As they have to watch over Berry all day, they agree to pick the winner between the two of them by each teaching their little sister their best techniques to catch insects! But with so much time spent challenging each other, they forget about Berry and eventually have to combinetheir different skills to manage to get her out of a very risky predicament...

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous friends come to his house for a fun and spooky Halloween party.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets to choose one toy from the store, but there are so many cool toys to pick from!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas travels to Australia where he helps his friend Ace overcome his fear of animals so that he can compete in a super stunt rally.

programme.title: Chuggington 02
programme.desc: Zephie admires the big chuggers, and wants to pull freight just like them. Brewster is dismissive when she offers to help him - you have to be big and strong to do the things he does. When Zephie overhears Brewster being given his jobs for the day, she decides to do some of them for him. Then he’ll see just how good she is at pulling freight! But Zephie creates chaos, delivering eggs to the Safari Park and animal feed to the ice cream factory. Baffled Brewster races round trying to put everything right. But Zephie gets in real trouble when she tries to pull some heavy tiles - she derails!

programme.title: Chuggington 02
programme.desc: A magazine photographer is coming to Chuggington to do a feature on steam trains. Olwin is determined to look her best for her picture and heads for the chugwash. Along the way, she encounters Wilson and Brewster tugging a car back and forth between them, arguing over who gets to deliver Ebo the elephant’s special soap. Neither of them wants to do the other job - a quarry delivery. Big-hearted Olwin says she’ll do the quarry run, so that they can both go to the Safari Park.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley and his friends are cycling in the forest with Mehdi. But suddenly, Paige hears noises... Could it be the wolf?! Paulie is thrilled, hes always dreamt of seeing him! Medhi reassures his little world that it must be rabbits trotting around. But the noises get louder and everyone is amazed to see a big red tail...!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Tweet’s new friend Fluttery Butterfly introduces Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to all his fluttery butterfly friends in the Jungle. Along the way they meet a hungry caterpillar who is getting ready to sleep in his cocoon. They are surprised to learn that this clever little caterpillar with eventually grow up in the safety of his cocoon and magically transform into a beautiful butterfly, just like Fluttery!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who has the most extraordinary costume in the savannah? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw a Zebra

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the African savannah, Jane and Zumi discover a baby giraffe stuck in quicksand during their run. In the garden, Leo, Katie, and Hero engage in a game of the grass is lava”, trying to approach a safe area using planks. Jane calls them and lets them know about the giraffe in need. Leo and Katie learn about South African giraffes on the computer. They rush to the savannah in PlatypusOne to rescue the baby giraffe. They tried to approach the giraffe using the jetpack but it scared it instead. Hence, failing their first attempt. Katie gets inspired by their ‘the grass is lava’ game earlier and suggests they use flat pieces of bark to get to it and successfully pull the giraffe to safety with a harness. Now safe, the giraffe’s neck is now going in all different directions which worry the rangers but Ranger Rocky appears, revealing the baby giraffe was just sleepy. He calls Ranger Joey who provides additional information about giraffes, and the rangers set out to reunite the baby with its mother. They locate the mother and see her neck stuck between branches which they manage to free her from. They successfully reunite the baby giraffe with its mother. In the Garden, playing a game of ‘grass is lava’, Katie takes a leap to get onto the ‘safe area’ but at the last minute, Hero crashes into her.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanley, the stag beetle, and his friends excitedly try out the new traffic park, practicing the rules of the road with roller skates, scooters, bicycles, and small motorcycles. However, Balthazar, the bee, ignores the signs and causes a minor accident by driving recklessly. With the help of the Queen Ant, the little friends learn traffic rules and signs so they can play safely and happily together.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In the fall, the chimney sweep smoke beetle visits the forest friends to clean their chimneys. In Patricks chimney, he finds a shiny hair clip that turns out to be a gift Dolly sent to Katie via Pigeon Post. The friends solve the mystery together, and Katie finally receives the shiny hair clip.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends are picking apples when an old steam locomotive appears on the hill. At the request of the scarlet beetle train engineer, the little friends help repair the locomotive and paint the wagons in bright colors. The cinnabar beetle thanks them by taking them on a special train trip to the great waterfall. The friends enjoy the journey and have a fun day together. At the end of the trip, they happily return home with the colorful train.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide And Seek at the crèche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesn’t go to the toilet with all the others before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding place or try and hold on.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: A blockage somewhere in the sparkleberry juice system that powers Berry Bitty City results in a repair crew of Berrykins invading the town with jackhammers. The girls leave for the day to avoid the noise and not get in the workers’ way. Trying to make the best of the situation, Strawberry gets an idea for the girls to have fun by holding their own berry bitty relay race—passing the baton from a sailboat race on the lake, to a steeple chase on frogs, to a sky race on birds.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmund has just found the precious kite he made in hischildhood. He makes the children promise not to touch it and leaves to pick corncobs with Margaret and Berry. The temptation is too strong for Scoutbadger to resist it and he tries the kite. As he has it gliding in the sky, Scoutbadger trips and loses it… The children start a high-speed chase across the forest to recover it.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble catches a cold, and Dr. Owl suggests drinking elderflower tea. Flutter sets out to gather elderflowers and meets Harmony, the glass-winged butterfly. Harmony teaches Flutter how to make the tea properly. Thanks to the delicious drink, Bubble soon recovers, and they celebrate spring with their new friend Harmony over a tasty elderflower syrup.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is impressed by Sarah, Sams older sister, who is preparing to sing on the theater stage. Julia does everything to attend the rehearsals but its not always easy to get noticed by a big girl.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: It is raining a lot outside and the Triplets are bored. Only people who have no imagination get bored, says Mom. The Triplets have many faults but a lack of imagination is not one of them! They start pretending they are drifting on a raft. They reach a desert island on which they will have to survive on their own. But beware: pirates are approaching! Good thing Captain Mom is there to save them and prepare them a delicious heartwarming dinner after all these adventures!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When Turbulent comes back with a balloon he got for free on the beach, Poet is jealous. But the balloon lady thinks its Turbulent coming back and refuses to give Poet the balloon hes asking for.She gives the same answer to Girl, thinking Turbulent is disguised. Enough is enough! The Triplets are sick and tired of people getting them mixed up, they want to be different. Maybe if Poet got fat or Girl changed her hair color, people would make the difference?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko let her excitement get the best of her and stayed up all night! Can Brewster and Wilson honk Koko awake in time for her to take the Mayor to a special ceremony at the docks?

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: It’s the Pontypandy Ocean Parade and Hannah is determined to beat the other vessels to the finish with her Submaster 2000, but because she decides to bypass several of Joes safety features, the most unlikely vessel wins.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: James has the idea of using the horse and cart to deliver his team’s forgotten cherry pop to a tasting competition. / Norman practices his magic act for the talent show, but it turns out that his assistant Mandy is better at magic than he is.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: While cloud-gazing with Mom and Dad, Kate points to a cloud that looks like Mim-Mim, but Dad can’t see it. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends pull clouds down from the sky to build a bouncy cloud castle. But problems arise when it starts floating away!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to build a snow fort, but there isn’t enough snow in the yard. In Mimiloo, Kate and her friends go snow bowling in the Winter Waterfalls. They use snowballs as bowling balls and snowmen for the pins. But when the gang slides down into an ice cave, Kate will have to think creatively to get them out!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Leo is moving away to a new house and Caillou is angry that Leo seems excited about it. An imaginary train adventure shows Caillou that Leo’s moving doesn’t mean the end of their friendship; it’s just an obstacle that they will have to find a new path around.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou visits Leo in his new house and finds him unhappy, Caillou is determined to cheer up his friend. They play trains and go on a fantastical adventure where Leo learns to look on the bright side of a difficult situation, and Caillou learns how to better empathize with his friend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sidney is a very hard working diesel, but he’s also very forgetful. One day The Fat Controller gives him a very special job – Sidney needs to go to Brendam Docks to collect Percy’s new wheels. But when Sidney admits that he’s worried he might forget what he has to do, Thomas suggests making up a little song to help him remember. Sidney goes off happily singing a song about collecting a crate from Brendam docks, but when he stops to talk to Gordon he gets distracted, forgets what he’s supposed to be doing, and ends up at The Waste Dump looking for boilers then The Animal Park waiting for an elephant!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo is stranded in the middle of a river, surrounded by scary river monsters. Will the Junior Rangers be able to save him? Are these river monsters as scary as they seem?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle witnesses an amazing phenomenon on Christmas Island - the migration of the red crabs. But his fascination is quickly replaced by worry - what if they have to cross the road to get to the beach? What if they get lost? The rangers are on it!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Alf has planted a garden full of raspberries, but the naughty birds are eating them all!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The Greendale Flyer is ready for a trip to the seaside!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Daisy find a duckling who’s lost her mother. With the help of the Egg Twins, Madame Butterfly and Johnny Snowman, they search all over town, but can’t find her anywhere. Daisy grows fond of the duckling as it reaches out to her for comfort but, when they find its mother, she reluctantly accepts the duckling is back where she belongs.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald inadvertently makes a date to watch TV with Henry at the same time that hes supposed to go swimming with Daisy. He tries to do both without telling his friends. But as he runs back and forth, he gets more and more mixed up, with hilarious results. Finally, he confesses the truth, and they decide to combine both activities so that they can all be together.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Scoop is fascinated by a heavy storm, but the impressive lightning damages the Fixham Lighthouse. Bob and the team must repair its lamp and replace its main power cable before dark. On the way they pass Curtis at the Marina and learn that the storm also damaged his motor boat, which hes trying to fix. While Lofty helps remove and replace the lamp, Scoop digs up the old power cable from the lighthouse to shore. With the tide coming in and night-time approaching, Bob and Wendy stay at the lighthouse to finish the job. They get the lamp working again, just as a new lightning storm arrives. Fascinated by the lightning, Scoop accidentally pulls out the new cable and cuts the power.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are creating a Soft Play Cafe for Chef Tattie in an old warehouse by the docks, ready for an opening party tomorrow. Though the build is on track, Chef can’t decide what colour to paint the disco room so Bob offers to put up paint samples for him to choose from. Leo shows off his ‘mash-up’ app and Tattie decides that Leo should DJ for the party. However, Leo isn’t as confident as he appeared to Chef and the extra responsibility distracts him from the build. Eventually he ends up walking through spilled paint after putting up the colour samples, leaving differently coloured footprints all over the floor.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. It’s too little to speak and doesn’t look like any creature Little Nutbrown Hare or his friends have seen before. How will he return it to its parents if he doesn’t know what kind of creature it is?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare sees Blue Bird building a nest, he thinks it looks like fun, so he and Little Field Mouse build one themselves. But its a bit too scratchy and tickly for them to get comfortable in. They give it to their friends to try out, but they also find it not quite right. Will anybody find their nest cozy and useful?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Osbourne is teaching Timmy how to do magic tricks. What will he pull out of his hat?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids awesome sandcastle gets trampled overnight. A lone set of footprints along the beach leads to a prime suspect who claims not to have seen their sandcastle, yet hes carrying a big shell that once adorned it. As it turns out, no one touched their castle. The culprit was the rising waters of high tide. / /Huckle, Sally and Lowly discover the impossible – a set of ski tracks that run on either side of a tall tree.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, a poorly Messy is sitting in the living room feeling very sorry for himself. “Aaachooo!” he sneezes and he wipes his nose with a tissue. “Don’t like colds” he groans “but I love green socks” and guzzles down the nearest green sock he can find. Hmmm Messy looks confused and not satisfied at all. “Why does food taste different when I have a cold?” He transports himself to Okido to find out.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, a single floating red balloon has caught Messy’s curiosity in the garden. Messy takes a gigantic leap into the air to catch the balloon as it floats past him but it’s no use! Other blue balloons bob on the ground but they don’t look as fun and floaty at all. “Aww”, says Messy, “I really wanted that red balloon! Why do some balloons float but others don’t?” He glances disappointedly at the red balloon as it continues to float further out of his reach. He transports himself to Okido to find out.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Blueberry and Huckleberry pitch their new play, an adaptation of the Baby Berrykins’ favorite BerryFairyTale, “The Littlest Berrykin,” to Plum and the assembled cast and crew. We see the story they are narrating in action: a comedy about three princesses (played by Strawberry, Lemon and Raspberry) on a quest for a fabled Golden Berry to determine which of them is best suited to rule the kingdom—the King and Queen (Huck and Blueberry) are retiring to the tropics. Accompanied by their Berrykins-in-Waiting, the Princesses set off on the quest. Whichever one returns with the Golden Berry will be declared the new monarch.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry finds a skipping rope outside his house and decides that Finders should be Keepers, so he goes to Dino World to play with it.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is nervous about giving a speech about dinosaurs to his classmates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On an Australian beach, Kyle builds a sandcastle until he stumbles upon a fishing net endangering a stranded Manta Ray. Simultaneously, Leo, Katie, and Hero engage in a garden frog hunt. Hero detects a croaking sound, leading them to a frog stuck in a drain pipe. As they rescue the frog, Kyle calls Leo about the trapped Manta Ray. From the computer, they learn about Manta Rays and their need for constant motion to breathe. Racing to the beach in PlatypusOne, they find Kyle tirelessly trying to keep the Manta Ray wet. Katies knowledge about Manta Rays prompts them to prioritize putting the fish back into the water before untangling the net. Utilizing the winch, they successfully pull the Manta Ray into the sea. However, their underwater celebration is disrupted when a fake shark fin alarmingly approaches them which turns out to be Ranger Rocky. He calls Ranger Joey who educates them on Manta Rays unique features, and they try to gently remove the net, freeing the Manta Ray. In the Garden, Hero playfully chases the frog, which ends up in the drainpipe revealing Hero to be the reason the frogs are in the pipe!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The Troublesome Trucks are being particularly cheeky and disobedient. When a new brake van called Bradford arrives from The Mainland Thomas is delighted to work with him as Bradford is excellent at keeping The Troublesome Trucks under control. But Bradford is a real stickler for the rules, and Thomas soon tires of his petty regulations, which are always making him late.. Eventually Thomas is so fed up with Bradford that he decides to go off without a brake van, a reckless and dangerous move, which ends up with Thomas hurtling out of control down Gordon’s Hill with no brake van to stop him.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Samson boasts proudly that he has been given a very special job taking stone from the quarry to the docks. But when he learns that Thomas has been given the same job he tries to find another way to prove how important he is. So he decides to take much more trucks than he should insisting that this will save time. But with so many heavy trucks Samson can’t get over Gordon’s Hill. So it takes even longer and when he asks Thomas to help him, he ends up making Thomas late too. The Fat Controller is not happy, but Samson insists that he’s learned his lesson and won’t make the same mistake again…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Gertrud promised Maria to make a perfume for Toramento with whom she has a first date tonight. Unfortunately, Gertruds laboratory has burned down and with it, all the ingredients. Grisus mission (with Stella’s help) is to find the flowers the perfume requires and to help Gertrud to make the perfume again. But finding the flowers is not an easy thing, especially with Thingy around. Moreover, Grisu, peeved by Fume, spits a flame, and burns all the ingredients once more! But Grisu is a resourceful dragon, and he manages to create the perfume Maria expects just in time for her romantic date!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu helps Professor Smeraldo to retrieve a Dragonosarus egg from the icecap. Fume joins the mission too, hoping to do some dragon training. They must prevent the prehistoric egg, caught in an iceblock, from falling off a crevasse, but a hungry albatross pops out and the mission is not so easy since the ice block ends up falling into the crevasse. Luckily, snowdrift softers the impact but our heroes find themselves without any rope to bring the egg back. In the end, the little dragon creates an ice firefighter pole using Smeraldos searching material and manages the rescue the egg with Fumè’s help.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. It’s too little to speak and doesn’t look like any creature Little Nutbrown Hare or his friends have seen before. How will he return it to its parents if he doesn’t know what kind of creature it is?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare sees Blue Bird building a nest, he thinks it looks like fun, so he and Little Field Mouse build one themselves. But its a bit too scratchy and tickly for them to get comfortable in. They give it to their friends to try out, but they also find it not quite right. Will anybody find their nest cozy and useful?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Koko and Brewster must keep to a schedule picking up passengers. Koko is too eager and gets ahead of schedule, while Brewster is too cautious and gets behind schedule – but in the end, they both learn to run on time!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie dreams of winning this years Raffle prize: a set of colored paints! So when she learns that the Cats intend to cheat in order to win it, only to waste it away… she makes a bad decision: she’ll be cheating too.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Bentley is doing vocal warm-ups with the Spring City Rockets, and is about to begin rehearsals for his latest masterpiece, “A Pocketful of Pirates”. As Bob, Wendy, Leo, Dizzy and Muck arrive to renovate the hilltop theatre, Mr Bentley encourages them to join in the warm-ups. But Bob proves to be a hopeless thespian. As he confesses: I’m a builder, not a actor!” But Dizzy shows theatrical flair. When Mr Bentley has to run home and retrieve an important prop, he asks Dizzy to assistant direct. She’s so excited by the task that she accidentally tells Leo to use slow-drying cement instead of fast-drying cement as they begin paving a hillside track down to the theatre. Torn between two important tasks - the play and the build - Dizzy also messes up her directorial duties, telling Brandon to get his pirate props from the wrong box.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are on site to create a temporary city beach for the summer in Spring City. Bob explains that they will be using sand from a real beach. Mr. Bentley interrupts to inform them that he wants it to be a ‘Blue Ribbon’ beach, an eco award for the cleanest, safest beaches, so they will have to work hard to keep the site tidy. There will be an inspection later in the day and he is determined for them to get the award for Spring City. Lofty takes this very seriously and is worried when Muck spills sand on the site.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari explores mangrove mudflats, discovering a moulted shell of a Mangrove Horseshoe Crab. In the Hero Garden, Leo and Katie engage in a toy jumping competition, using a DIY see-saw, while Hero watches. Leo receives a call from Zari, who found the crab shell, prompting Leo and Katie to investigate using the computer. Katie provides information about the Mangrove Horseshoe Crab, and the team rushes to Zaris aid when she gets stuck in the mud when she tries to approach an overturned crab. They travel in PlatypusOne and rescue Zari, then discover a group of overturned crabs, which makes their skin crawl at the creepy sight. They meet Ranger Rocky who calls up Ranger Joey. She provides information about the harmless crabs and how to flip them back up, safely. The Junior Rangers overcome their fear and, with Heros assistance, successfully flip the crabs. Back in the treehouse, Leo hangs up a picture of the mangrove horseshoe crab, celebrating the missions success. Ranger Rocky praises the Junior Rangers as they throw Hero’s treats to him via the same see-saw from earlier.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah explores the Southeast Asian seabed, documenting marine life for her handbook. Surprisingly, she discovers a sea spider, leading her to seek information from Leo and Katie. Leo and Katie are playing golf in the garden which ends up with Hero rescuing a snail from Katie’s golf ball. Leo receives a call from Farah, reporting an underwater spider, prompting a visit to the computer. Katie provides information on sea spiders, and during the call, Farah notices the spider caught in a strong current. The team travels to Farah to rescue the sea spider. They find the spider trapped among rocks, but a sudden current poses a threat. They take cover behind a rock as the current passes. They go back to check on the crab and only see one spider leg, but no sight of the spider! They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey who shares insights about sea spiders and their unique features, including that the sea spider can regrow limbs. A little relieved regarding the leg, the spider is still missing! An underwater search ensues, and the team finds it on Hero’s backpack. They safely release it onto a coral in the reef. Back at the treehouse, Leo hangs up a picture of the sea spider, marking the completion of their mission. In the garden, Katie gives another try at golf but as she’s about to win, Hero grabs her golf ball and runs away, much to Katie’s frustration.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle is in the shrubland, Australia and is checking for any cool animal he can see. Feeling dejected of not finding any as he was about to leave, he then discover a Quokka. Back in the garden, Leo is taking a photo of a bird resting on a branch. The picture hes taken are reveal to be blurry, where Katie later does the same and it turns out clear. Confused of the situation, Leo receives a call from Kyle of a cute animal he discover in Australia when suddenly a drone appear and is chasing the animal down. After learning more of the Quokka, the Junior Ranger rushes to Kyles location to help the animal. Once theyre there, they reunite with Kyle and hide in the bushes. Kyle reveals the animal and the Junior Rangers fawning over it. This causes Hero to be jealous of not getting attention. Katie attempts to hack the drone with her tablet but its taking longer to load than she expected. As Katie works on her tablet, Kyle and Leo continue to gush over the Quokka. Hero keeps getting more annoyed and attempts to gain their attention but fails. This causes Hero to bark which the drone hears the commotion and continue to chase the Quokka. The Junior Rangers run after the drone that keeps pursuing the cute critter. The Junior Rangers use their jetpack and stop the drone from harassing the animal. The quokka then hides in a log but the drone keeps hover above it, scaring the animal. Kyle feel frustrated and toss his boomerang at the drone to which he fail and Ranger Rocky appear to catch it.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon goes to the pool for a swimming lesson. Mommy and Gaspard accompany him. While they wait for him to finish his lesson, they go play in the wading pool. Though he is excited at the beginning of his lesson, Simon quickly changes his mind. Because before he can use the big water slide, he has to warm up and do a super complicated exercise: he has to swim underwater and come out of the water through a life preserver. Pffff, this is way too hard, hell never be able to do it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda asks Edna to repair her entrance door that creaks so loudly that her guests want to leave Guesthouse Appleseed. But normally, Rupert does all repairing work for Tilda and interferes.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that he has grown a thick Winter coat, he and Little Field Mouse make a coat from moss to help other creatures in the meadow stay warm. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.desc: Simon takes his first-ever sailing lessons and teams up with Maelle, but they have to learn to work together if they are going to manage their boat successfully.

programme.desc: Koko is put in charge of Wilson and Brewster. The team has to complete a newspaper round by a certain time. Koko nearly fails and learns that being bossy isn’t the best way to lead. programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi loves picking vegetables in the vegetable garden! But when Mom asks him if he remembered to water the tomato plants, as per her request this morning, he freaks out: he was too busy having fun and forgot! In a mad rush, he gets Nina to help him find a way to keep Mom busy while he quickly waters the tomatoes. But it just doesn’t seem to work: the plants look positively sick!... But, what if there’s another way to tend to vegetables…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas’ new Italian friends, Lorenzo and his coach Beppe, do everything together, but one day, Lorenzo decides he’d like to do things by himself for a change. Beppe is hurt when Lorenzo leaves him behind so he can deliver the legendary Opera Star, Bella Canto, to a music festival. Lorenzo meets his match in Bella - she’s a soloist and a diva who wants to do everything by herself, her way! She doesn’t let Lorenzo join in with her singing and demands he take her a different route. Not wanting to let her down, Lorenzo follows her command, but without his trusty Beppe – and his sense of direction – they end up lost! Luckily, Beppe knows that, deep down, his friend needs him, so comes to rescue and the pair are reunited once more.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
